since_last_update: Dominant tape shift: US equity-index futures attempting to stabilize/rebound after a tech-led drawdown, with the week’s driver framed as skepticism toward Big Tech AI capex intensity vs near-term monetization (Reuters, FT).

AI-capex shock crystalized further via Amazon guiding materially higher 2026 capex (roughly +50% y/y), reinforcing the ‘capex without payback’ narrative that has driven de-rating pressure in software/mega-cap duration proxies (Reuters, FT).
Cross-asset: signs of higher implied uncertainty persist even as futures bounce (vol-sensitive framing in premarket commentary; risk of sharp intraday reversals remains elevated) (Barron’s, Reuters).

Europe growth impulse: Germany industrial production printed a larger-than-expected decline (-1.9% m/m vs -0.3% est per feed), reinforcing EU cyclical downside and biasing global growth/rates tone toward ‘slower-growth’ (NEW info; driver check pending broader confirmation).

Canada policy tone: BoC Governor Macklem sounded cautious on easing if weakness is structural (NEW info), a marginally tighter-conditions signal that can matter at the margin for North American rates/risk if it tightens global DM financial conditions via spillover.
today_focus: Primary driver to watch: ‘AI capex payback’ risk-premium repricing (mega-cap + software) remains the main equity-index lever; watch whether NQ leadership stabilizes or rebounds are sold into (Reuters, FT).

Rates linkage: monitor whether the session is ‘rates down = relief’ (duration bid supports NQ/ES) versus ‘rates up = de-rate’ (real yields up, tech underperforms); premarket commentary flags 10Y yields higher alongside futures bounce, implying fragile correlation regime (Barron’s).
Gold focus: gold acting more as a risk/real-yield barometer than a pure hedge; watch for (i) USD/real-yield pressure vs (ii) safe-haven bid if equity vol re-accelerates (Barron’s, AP).

Data catalyst: University of Michigan prelim sentiment + inflation expectations at 10:00 ET is the cleanest macro catalyst for a discrete rates repricing today (tariff/price-expectations sensitivity has been a recent market trigger) (Bloomberg via ForexFactory).

Microstructure: end-of-week positioning/vol control likely amplifies moves; ‘bounce’ attempts can be mechanically faded if systematic deleveraging remains active after a tech drawdown (inference; consistent with elevated vol framing) (Reuters, Barron’s).

dominant_driver.driver: AI capex / monetization skepticism driving a tech-duration risk-premium reset

what_is_priced: Higher equity risk premium in mega-cap tech and software linked to concern that AI spend is accelerating faster than visible ROI (Reuters, FT).
Near-term stabilization attempt in index futures, but with weekly drawdown context keeping dip-buying selective and factor rotations defensive (Reuters).
what_may_be_underpriced: Second-order earnings risk: guidance/estimates may lag the capex reality, creating ‘rolling’ downgrade risk beyond the initial headline capex shocks (inference; consistent with Reuters/FT framing).
Concentration risk: NQ/ES performance increasingly sensitive to a small set of AI-capex names; a continuation lower can transmit to broader risk even if non-tech is stable (inference).

what_is_priced: High sensitivity of front-end expectations to inflation-expectations data and Fed communication; small data surprises can generate outsized cross-asset beta (Bloomberg via ForexFactory).
what_may_be_underpriced: Policy-credibility risk premium tails: if inflation expectations re-accelerate, markets can abruptly reprice the ‘cuts’ path and hit duration equities and gold simultaneously (inference; driver check).

what_is_priced: Gold moving with the rates/USD impulse in the near term; premarket notes show gold modestly higher alongside mixed risk tone, implying no single dominant hedge bid today (Barron’s, AP).
what_may_be_underpriced: If equity vol spikes again, forced selling/liquidity stress can cause gold to fail as a hedge (prior open risk; still relevant) (inference).

risk_register.risk: AI-capex shock broadens into a deeper tech-duration de-rating (software + mega-cap) and drags index-level risk via concentration; rebounds get sold as ‘capex-without-monetization’ narrative persists
UoM inflation expectations surprise higher → front-end reprices hawkish, real yields up → NQ underperforms and gold pressured (or gold rallies on policy-credibility fears; correlation unstable)
Vol-control / systematic deleveraging into Friday close amplifies any downside impulse; liquidity air-pockets possible if another mega-cap headline hits
EU growth downside (Germany IP) feeds a renewed global growth scare narrative; cyclicals/industrials weaken while rates rally, creating cross-asset whipsaw
Gold/metal volatility transmits into broader VAR/margin dynamics (forced selling), causing simultaneous pressure in equities and precious metals

event_warnings: 10:00 ET (15:00 UTC) University of Michigan prelim sentiment + inflation expectations: watch for an inflation-expectations jump as the clean trigger for rates and tech-duration beta.
13:00 ET (17:00 UTC) Fed Vice Chair Jefferson speaks: risk is a policy-path headline that interacts with inflation-expectations sensitivity (especially if UoM is surprising).
15:00 ET (20:00 UTC) Consumer credit: usually second-order, but could matter if market is already in a growth-scare frame and looking for confirmation on consumer resilience.
Ongoing earnings/capex guidance risk: additional AI capex headlines can re-ignite the tech rout even if macro data is quiet (Reuters, FT).
